intro: Erigeron macrorrhizus, commonly known as the large-root fleabane, is a flowering plant native to North America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in open habitats such as meadows, prairies, and woodland edges. It features a taproot system and produces fluffy, white to pinkish ray flowers that attract pollinators. Its leaves are usually lance-shaped with toothed margins, and it is often found in disturbed soils.
